title: Ticket #2087: Conflicting descriptions of job priority
description: The description of the JobPrio attribute (http://www.cs.wisc.edu/condor/manual/v6.6/2_5Submitting_Job.html) says that a higher numerical priority is worse. But the "Priorities and Preemption" section of the manual (http://www.cs.wisc.edu/condor/manual/v7.6/2_7Priorities_Preemption.html#SECTION00371000000000000000) says higher is better. And the "Changing the priority of jobs" section (http://www.cs.wisc.edu/condor/manual/v7.6/2_6Managing_Job.html#sec:job-prio) doesn't say anything about which way is "better". The condor_submit man page (http://www.cs.wisc.edu/condor/manual/v7.6/condor_submit.html) also says higher is "better".
remarks:
2011-Jul-01 11:05:30 by smoler:
It appears that the problem discovered was within the 6.6 manual, and that the problem no longer exists in the 7.6 manual. So, we're resolving this ticket without changing anything.
creator: wenger
